website_summaries.verdict: This drywall lift allows you to hang drywall and plywood by yourself with ease.
pros: Handles up to 150 pounds of 4-by-16-foot sheets, lifting them 11 feet into the air
Has an all-welded steel frame and base on locking casters
cons: Occasionally, some of the welds are not as strong as they should be

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality and you’ll be lucky to not get seriously injured
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help on a drywall job and it’s not sturdy at all it wobbles and then on the 3rd sheet as my coworker was slowly cranking it up the cable snapped and the big metal frame along with a full sheet of 5/8s drywall hit him in the head and he had to go to the hospital. I requested to return it and they agreed but don’t pay for return shipping and it costs more to ship it back than the thing costs. Please do not buy this if you need a jack go to local store so if there’s a defect your not stuck with a bunch of useless metal
customer_reviews.author: Shane b

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues with Weld Joints
customer_reviews.text: On lifting the 5th sheet of 1/2"x48"x96" drywall to the ceiling, I heard a loud bang and discovered that one of the hinges for a tripod leg had broken. Inspection showed that the bottom of that hinge had been tack-welded in place, but the complete weld had not been done. Took it to a local welder who reinforced all of the hinges for me and hopefully it will be fine. None of the welds were what I would judge to be good quality. Looked like I did the welding, and I know what a good weld looks like, but not HOW to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Mclain

customer_reviews.title: The real advantage of purchasing this over renting one is that you can take as long as you like to put up your ceiling
customer_reviews.text: This is very loosely made, thus it almost never binds and it self adjusts to uneven surfaces. I gave it 4 stars because you really need two people to put a sheet of drywall on it. As the DIYer is the target market the spouse or elder sun is likely to be called into service. Be prepared for some gritching. The real advantage of purchasing this over renting one is that you can take as long as you like to put up your ceiling. I also used this to hold florescent fixtures to the ceiling while screwing them in place.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and strong material
customer_reviews.text: Great home lift. There are a few basic things but if your handy enough to use this you can fix them. One is where the pins that hold sheetrock from sliding off ar not located properly when you are putting sheets on sloped ceilings. overall great value compared to renting for 4 days at 60 bucks a day!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald d Pawlak

customer_reviews.title: Steal of a Deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool, especially for the money. The price is almost too good to be true. No more hoisting drywall panels with my head and a T made from a 2x4. My local discount tool "warehouse" has almost the same lift for $100 more. My only gripe is that it doesn't come with any instructions at all, but it's easy to figure out when you look at the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Jack the Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: It completely knocks down for easy storage. If I had to pick one thing ...
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat this lift for the price. I bought it to drywall my garage and I had it knocked out in short order working by myself. I had planned to sell it when I was finished with the project, but since it cost so little, I'm just going to hang on to it. It completely knocks down for easy storage. If I had to pick one thing that I did not like; it's the lower quality rubber pieces on the support arms of the lift. They are soft and they don't mar, but they do leave black skid marks on your drywall. No big deal if you are painting your drywall... so, only a minor gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Way better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cheaper than i could rent a lift for the weekend. Finished the ceilings of (2)of my rentals, 1500sq ft basements with it. Was easy to use and worked like a charm. After all that use however it is starting to show a little wear and tear on the leveling arm (drywall is no longer lying flat but at a slight angle) . But still works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Assembled but not put to work yet.
customer_reviews.text: The lift was assembled and tested, but the really one will be carried out 2 weeks later - when I have scheduled the ceiling work in my basement. The whole setup is heavy, especially the central lift manifold. Disassembling and assembling seems to be easy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Tse

customer_reviews.title: Astonishing
customer_reviews.text: There are no words. If you need to Sheetrock a ceiling, but this! It's the best price --- I've looked. It's bulky for storage, but believe me, you and your friends helping you will thank you. The only alternative is to have 2-3 friends on ladders trying to support a sheet while you go around drilling it into place. You can get it tight against the rafters and tightly in place next to corners and other sheets of drywall. I had to redo my living room and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great tool at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my needs. I've never hung drywall before so it was a bit ambitious to start with a ceiling project, but this made it easy. It arrived a little dirty/dusty from manufacturing, but all components fit together well and it functioned as expected. It was the same price as renting a lift for a weekend. The only disadvantage is that it is heavy and bulky and can be challenging to store after use.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality but good for one job
customer_reviews.text: This thing will get the job done but the quality is very questionable and I am sure it will not last. Very clunky and the cable balls up and is a very poor design. That said I did hang 60 sheets of OSB on a ten foot ceiling in my shop by myself with this lift. the quality is about what you would expect from Harbor Freight so be aware it is only going to be good for a couple of uses before it crashes and it may get you hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to install a ceiling in a small garage,It was just what I needed. It worked perfect and the price was right. I don't know the brand that was in our local stores, but they were over a $100.00 higher. The lift cable needs to be guided on pulley while lifting to keep from damaging the cable was the only problem I had. This does not take away anything from the lift and I would recommend it for small jobs, I installed 1/2 " 8ft sheetrock.
customer_reviews.author: James  Watson

customer_reviews.title: ... of the garage and for the price it worked wonderfully. I docked a star because the little handle ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to put some steel panels up on the ceiling of the garage and for the price it worked wonderfully. I docked a star because the little handle for the cable brake (to lower the lift) broke off before I even used it but it wasn't a big deal as simply locking a vise grip to it replaced it. Otherwise, as you can expect its pretty cheaply made but for small projects it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon J.

customer_reviews.title: the packaging is very poor and I was surprised to see the unit in ...
customer_reviews.text: As previous reviewers have written, the packaging is very poor and I was surprised to see the unit in one piece by looking at the holes and tears in the packaging box. The directions are just OK but there should not be any worries as the tool was assembled in a matter of minutes and ready to roll. It is simple to use and seems to be able to handle the job. Too bad this gizmo arrived after the battle but I expect to use it for the next bedroom project.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a dream!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lift because when I went to rent one, it would have cost more than the purchase price on Amazon to own it. It assembled fairly easy and worked like a dream in lifting 3/4" drywall up 10'. Used it completely by myself and had no issues what so ever. Unit is sturdy and having the capability to break it down for storage is a great advantage.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie

customer_reviews.title: This Equipment Is Very Useful!
customer_reviews.text: This equipment works extremely well. It is solid and well built. It makes it so easy to lift heavy panels into the ceiling. It is so helpful that I wished I had it years ago. It would have saved me a lot of headaches. But the good news is : I have it now. Thanks for inventing such a great tool!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: This is a great deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: small design flaw makes the crank scrape the support cable the raises the sheeting. This is a great deal for the price. just not perfect because of the design flaw. Easy enough to work with the design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Utnapishtim

customer_reviews.title: forgot feedback?Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works great?74 yrs old and can put up tin ceiling alone??
customer_reviews.author: Jim N.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: It was put together in 5 minutes, anyone who complains about the quality and cost of this wonderful little piece of equipment should put their sheetrock up without it. If you want a 500 dollar machine, buy a 500 dollar machine.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: The tool itself is awesome. Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: There are some reviews on this list complaining about the packaging or having a paint chip. Let's get real, it's a tool. Tolls get banged up, scratched and dented. The tool itself is awesome. Easy to assemble, easy to use, easy to store. I used to use the 2x4 T method. What a pain. One person can handle 4x8 1/2 inch drywall all day by themselves with this. As worn ant till worth moving parts, maintenance is needed every so often. A little lube one in a while keeps it working great. For a semi-pro, about 400 tpe 500 sheets a year, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Back breaker saver
customer_reviews.text: I am renovating my basement myself and installing 4x8 sheet rock would have been very difficult at best. The lifter came, I put it together in 10 minutes, and had a panal of dry wall on the ceiling in 5 minutes, highly recommend. Steve G
customer_reviews.author: SteveGord

customer_reviews.title: No sweat
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe that I hung drywall for 30 years using my head and 2x4's as lifts. This tool is great! I don't even work up a sweat. Easy to move and adjust rock even when lifted. If the sheet doesn't quite fit, just lower it and trim. I've even used it to raise sheets to second floor levels for easy off-loading. I've put plywood and shingles on one story roofs. I've used it to lift 100lb bales of hay into my barn loft. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: Great tool especially if you work alone like I do
customer_reviews.text: Great tool especially if you work alone like I do. Easy to load drywall on the hooks so you can score it then flip it over to ready to put in place. Make sure you load it even on both sides to even distrubute the weight evenly or will tend to go up at an angle. I used the to finish my 2car garage with 11ft ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: David G. R.

customer_reviews.title: My husband has been using it to put up drywall ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been using it to put up drywall on the ceiling and walls in our basement. He says it has worked quite well and made the work go much faster. Price was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra G. Nadelson

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, sturdy worl
customer_reviews.text: Gyptool dry wall lift easily lifted and positioned a 12 ' dry wall panel to an 8' ceiling. This product is well made, sturdy and easy to use. The large wheels and brakes work great. It does take 2 people or some ingenuity to place a 12' panel on the unit in the down position. overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Can't beat the price either
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Can't beat the price either. If you are going to do a lot of drywall, get this lift. Even if you are only doing a few projects, it will save your arms and back.
customer_reviews.author: drjones

customer_reviews.title: A must have tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool to do my basement ceiling rather than hire someone. This works better than even two people holding and installing ceiling drywall, especially 5/8". Was easy to complete the job by myself and at my pace over several weeks. Outstanding tool and worked as advertised. Since I don't expect to use this tool ever again, I will sell it as used and recover most of my money. Plus, I didn't have to hire a person to help me install the drywall. A win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Levin

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the greatest tool purchase i've ever made. For the price it's just as much as you'd pay a helper for only one day but this is on the job for the duration and it'll never be late for work
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Giroux

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Comes as 3 pieces that go together very well and also allowed me to easily haul these up in an attic space and put together as I needed it. Best money I spent that helped enormously with ceiling 5/8 drywall! Recommended highly!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wild

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great price! Way better than renting something similar all the time and trowing my money away. Only thing you may need to do is grease it every now and then since cable bearings squeak with the drywall dust.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool...Don't Wait 15 Years to Buy Like I Foolishly Did!
customer_reviews.text: An excellent tool that while I may not use it frequently it has more than paid for itself in very little time. I also believes that it accomplishes a higher quality complete job than when two guys are doing the hanging by hand. I was a remodeling contractor for about 23 before I actually purchased one of these lifts...only wish I would have done so 15 years earlier! Excellent quality. This is no rattle-a-part tool. It is heavy duty enough for even the most abusive of tool users.
customer_reviews.author: AlamedaMarc

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I researched more than one lift and choose this one I'm glad that I made a decision in buying this product. The design and construction of this product made the day a little easier using I would truly recommend this lift to a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: milton alcorn

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far and I think the longevity will be there. Only flaws are that it is somewhat dirty (metal shavings and/or rust presumably from the factory) when you receive it, the paint finish may have some imperfections, and the brake mechanism really isn't that effective. Considering the price and effectiveness, who cares? it's not the show piece - the drywall is
customer_reviews.author: Strike-Fighter

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Arrived when expected. Was easy to assemble... drywall project has been temporarily postponed however just playing around with the lifter has me convinced this was the right choice. Solidly constructed - I'm anxious to take full advantage of the new tool! Small investment for a big back savings!
customer_reviews.author: CJ in NW FL

customer_reviews.title: POS Broke First DAY
customer_reviews.text: First time using it. Put a 12’ sheet on it and halfway up the cable snapped. ITS A PEICE OF CRAP!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: I have been renting something similar for years and it's not as heavy duty as a rental unit but it works great and is well made
customer_reviews.text: It was just what I needed. I have been renting something similar for years and it's not as heavy duty as a rental unit but it works great and is well made for the work that I get and need a lift.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Spiller

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift. This product is for pros ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. This product is for pros. It did 4X8s quickly. Larger product must be done slowly with help and safely, always clean area.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Wow aaa rating this tool is amazing Hung 130 sheets of drywall no way it could ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow aaa rating this tool is amazing Hung 130 sheets of drywall no way it could have been done without it you can also hang beams too just a work horse tool like having two people help you
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lifter for contractors
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a contractor and he loves this. He recently did a renovation and this lifter was a life/back saver. Easily folds up and loads into his truck and he can set up it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: A very good Jack for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing sheet rock for over 30 years and had to do a large shop with 16 foot high ceilings. This Jack made a very difficult job much easier. I have used many jacks in the past and this one did as good as any. A very good Jack for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John Hay

customer_reviews.title: Great lift!
customer_reviews.text: Good price, I have been using this lift since it arrived and it works great. The shipping was super fast. I should have purchased one of these years ago, it saves a lot of time.
customer_reviews.author: Leo M.

customer_reviews.title: It is a bit unsteady but saves extra people and ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit unsteady but saves extra people and allows 1 person to hang 4 x 12 sheets on the ceiling single handed. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: One person can drywall their project.!
customer_reviews.text: I used it several days after I received it for the price it was excellent in my book. I was able to do all my drywall work by myself. I've rented these machines and used others and I see no differences.
customer_reviews.author: djasinski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this product - great value - solid product - worth it's weight in gold
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever.... My husband wishes he had this earlier as it helps him hang the drywall without me and or a 2x4.
customer_reviews.author: OverWorkedMom

customer_reviews.title: Works great for installing ceiling sheets but counldnt figure out how ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great for installing ceiling sheets but counldnt figure out how to adjust to hang sheets vertically. So was only half as useful as I hoped for doing a whole drywall on my garage solo.
customer_reviews.author: Justin S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice lift
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves product. Assembled it. Very sturdy. Haven't used it yet. Will update later
customer_reviews.author: Gooseylloosey

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, I am disabled with severe osteoarthritis and I can't do much lifting. This lift is a life saver and a back saver. Shipping was quick and assembly was easy. If you have drywall to put up and can't afford a contractor like me, I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Meto

customer_reviews.title: Drywall lift
customer_reviews.text: The lift was more than I expected. The guage of the metal was thicker. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: ... more holding the sheetrock up till my arms feel like jelly. It was easy to assemble and it ...
customer_reviews.text: No more holding the sheetrock up till my arms feel like jelly. It was easy to assemble and it comes apart in 30 seconds to transport and store. Love it. Adjusts for different sizes and walls or ceilings. Had a bid for 5 grand to do a hang and finish job so I bought the GypTool and a sander and I am WAAAY ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Goosemyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is just what my husband wanted - he put it together and it will work just fine when he finishes his garage workshop - the price is awesome !!! Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my purposes. I have a vaulted ceiling that peaks at about 11ft. It tilted the ceiling pitch perfectly. If I was doing really tall walls I would have wanted one that tilts 90 degrees to do he walls but for my purposes it worked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I could not ask for more from this tool,
customer_reviews.text: works well, making it so much easier to hang ceiling boards. quality is better than I expected, superb value tool.
customer_reviews.author: David Hoddle

customer_reviews.title: it could be packaged better.
customer_reviews.text: Works well but it arrived with several areas missing paint. it could be packaged better.
customer_reviews.author: Ken D Wynn

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to drywall a 500 square foot garage with 8 ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to drywall a 500 square foot garage with 8 and 12 foot sheets of 1/2" drywall. It felt very sturdy and seemed well built--0 complaints. This was less than half the cost of anything available locally, even from Harbor Freight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great lift
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well built especially for the price. In the past I have rented a drywall lift, this one compares to the rental unit as far as features and function.
customer_reviews.author: Swar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you want to hang drywall on a ceiling by yourself. This is what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathn Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Works for the job needed
customer_reviews.text: Worked good, but a pain to use. Still better than doing it all by hand.
customer_reviews.author: B. Friesen

customer_reviews.title: works GREAT, I even used it to lift an 80
customer_reviews.text: works GREAT, I even used it to lift an 80,000 BTU heater to the ceiling of my garage....for the money, you will NOT beat this tool
customer_reviews.author: David Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great value, excellent construction
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was 3 business days faster then scheduled. Great value, excellent construction. Going to work great for finishing the 2nd floor attic space and setting up my golf practice area.
customer_reviews.author: jjkshark

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: for $130 impressed at what you get, heavy duty. will lift my 5/8inch rock 10 feet up to my ceiling no problem. Im glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: compguy808

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Finishing my basement. Almost done with 1000 sqaure feet. Couldn't have done it with out this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Cbaracuta

customer_reviews.title: Flood repair
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! My daughter and I have been fixing our home after a flood. Due to funds available we have had to redo our entire home plus a few must needed repairs. Without gyp tool it would not be possible!
customer_reviews.author: deborah pearson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how people hang sheetrock without one of these. Wonderful tool to have.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: It works great. But just needs extra support on the back ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great. But just needs extra support on the back where the wheel is welded to it. It does bend with the weight.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brambila

customer_reviews.title: The tripod stand is pretty flimsy and the coasters will not freely rotate when ...
customer_reviews.text: Price is incredible. Performance is adequate. The tripod stand is pretty flimsy and the coasters will not freely rotate when trying to maneuver the thing, so I end up having to kick them to align them to desired direction. If I did this for a living - subpar. But since I am doing a 'one and done' project, it is perfectly adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Worked well right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The lift worked very well with 5/8" firecode sheetrock. Also installed 12" sheetrock. Sturdy and functions well.
customer_reviews.author: Henry E Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: great drywall lift and seller
customer_reviews.text: great lift! they are designed very well and are sturdy. there is no assembly needed and they break down to move easily. Im not using them (bought 2) for drywall but they will work fine. the seller shipped within 24 hours and had great communications... PERFECTION!!! thanks guys! keep up the good work
customer_reviews.author: jeffyd

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: THis device works great, as soon as you get used to it
customer_reviews.author: Pasquale Zullo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy to assemble. I just hate I didn't buy it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: zlg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: made hanging ceiling sheetrock easier than t-pole I have used
customer_reviews.author: srt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price, it works well lifting those heavy drywall sheets to the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Ranapi

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bit wobbly especially when going to the 2nd mast but overall worth the small price to own vs rent
customer_reviews.author: jordie24

customer_reviews.title: A great time saver
customer_reviews.text: A great time saver. I used it immediately after receiving and it worked great. It is a little shaky and the cable did a lot of squeaking but no problem. I felt that the platform could be a little tighter, and not quite so wobbly, but it definitely beats holding the wallboard up with your head like I used to do. For the price, I would recommend it to any home owner.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this to anyone. I did a 700 square foot addition and using this lift was simple. So much better than inviting friends over and holding aheets on your head while trying to screw them in!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I have rented these from home depot in the past and decided it was time to purchase one ! Have used it once so far and it definitely met my expectations, I would recommend this tool to anyone hanging drywall on ceilings.
customer_reviews.author: robert cruppi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price on a great item that has made our life so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Angie K

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and compact
customer_reviews.text: I've used many drywall lifts and this is my favorite. Its easier to store in my van than others and is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It made the job easy enough for one person to handle
customer_reviews.author: judy h.

customer_reviews.title: Drywall installation made easy for one person.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my "Gyptool 11"the quickness of the delivery,and the ease of assembly are just amazing.I would recommend this product for anyone installing drywall especially on ceilings. And the price is unbeatable.great product.
customer_reviews.author: william c. hewish III

customer_reviews.title: Not Real Smooth...
customer_reviews.text: This is not especially a precision piece of machinery. I used it for a single garage ceiling and it was almost, but not quite, more work than it was worth. I suppose I'm glad I spent the money but not sure I'm anxious to use it again. Biggest complaints? Doesn't really descend smoothly on the way down (empty of course). And when cranking a sheet up the cable often hangs up on the protruding bolt for the handle on the wheel. Annoying things in its first use that don't bode well for longevity. I can only give it 2 stars because I really can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Michaelsen

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for hanging drywall by yourself!!!
customer_reviews.text: Game changer for hanging drywall by yourself. Great product, well built, easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have at a very good price
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to have at a very good price. Assembly is quick and easy, and easily disassembled to move to another room. Stability is very good on 8 foot ceilings. I have not yet tried on higher ceilings, but i believe the jack will still work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. Saved me hundred by installing panels by myself
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the Gyptool 11 is as advertised easy to put together and will help a person working ...
customer_reviews.text: the Gyptool 11 is as advertised easy to put together and will help a person working alone hold up sheets for nailing or screwing I have limited space where Im working so the support legs seem to always be hitting something, but that is not the fault of the lift.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: What a life saver. Only down fall is that ...
customer_reviews.text: What a life saver. Only down fall is that the cable gets wound on top of itself which could drop lift when rasied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best tool buy in a long time...
customer_reviews.text: I even used it to lift a 3/4" pressure treated piece of plywood on the ceiling of my goat milking house by myself and then screwed it in place. Handled the weight just fine!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R.

customer_reviews.title: Will save you time and efforts
customer_reviews.text: This tool saves me a lot of trouble for installing drywall by myself.
customer_reviews.author: ES - Virginia

customer_reviews.title: This drywall lift worked great. It was perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: This drywall lift worked great. It was perfect for the price. I lubed the cables with some white lithium grease.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Just started using it, seems OK, only concern ...
customer_reviews.text: Just started using it, seems OK, only concern is it drops a little every once in a while, not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Right on time and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed. Right on time and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Alice M. Videlock

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For $120 bucks this thing is awesome, If you're drywalling a ceiling you need this!
customer_reviews.author: JERROD

customer_reviews.title: This has worked great for what I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great for what I bought it for. I built a two story garage with an apartment. I hung drywall in the appartent and plywood in the garage. It worked great for both and was cheaper then renting a professional one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Murphy

customer_reviews.title: easy assembly and cant beat the price
customer_reviews.text: well built, easy assembly and cant beat the price, I have seen used ones sell for twice of what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Travis T.

customer_reviews.title: Glad we got it.
customer_reviews.text: A great help for putting drywall on the ceiling. So much easier, and faster. And it was cheaper than what it was going to cost us to rent one.
customer_reviews.author: thill

customer_reviews.title: After I put some WD40 on the vertical bars, ...
customer_reviews.text: After I put some WD40 on the vertical bars, it goes up and down smoothly and has made the task of hanging 4x8 sheets of plywood on an 11' porch ceiling that is 80' long a breeze - one person job.
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: Good product !!
customer_reviews.text: Drywall lift works very well, I already know how to use it but instructions are not very explicit for someone that doesn't know how to assemble or use it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: great quality, cheaper than renting
customer_reviews.text: Top quality, way better than the beat up lifts from the tool rental places. And since I was going to need it for a few weeks, the great price made it way cheaper than renting, too! Delivered on time, easy peasy
customer_reviews.author: Butternutter

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: got it as described in a timely manner and it worked well
customer_reviews.author: Paul Putt

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: Product is great, especially for the price. Instructions are a little vague, but that is why I am a DIY'er.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Holmes

product_meta.title: GypTool Drywall Lift Panel Jack Hoist - 11' Reach Red
product_meta.description:
Designed for heavy-duty use by contractors and professionals, this deluxe drywall lifter and installation jack from GypTool features a new and improved winch crank operation, simplifying lifting, positioning and installation of drywall, sheetrock and wood panels on ceilings or walls for faster and more efficient work. 

Crafted with all-welded steel construction and coated with a premium enamel finish, this durable and heavyweight lift is built to last a lifetime. Hoist features an easy-to-operate hand winch and accommodates standard-sized panels, with a telescoping mast for fast and smooth sheetrock raising/lowering, with an 11' reach for flat ceilings. 

The entire unit is supported by a 4' wide tripod base with three swivel casters for easy rolling and positioning, that won't damage floors. Unit features a heavy-duty 3" triangular frame with clevis pins at critical juncture-points for added safety, and all casters lock to secure the lift's position for mounting. 

Lift features a quick, tool-free setup and disassembly for storage or easy portability. 

Working height: 36" - 11'. Max reach: 11' plus panel. Construction: Welded steel. Base: 4' tripod with locking casters. Maximum load: 150 pounds. Maximum panel: 4' x 16'. 

Well-known within the construction, home improvement, and commercial remodeling communities, GypTool is your trusted source for professional-grade products that provide lasting quality and durability.
feature_bullets: POWERFUL WINCH CRANK: Contractor-grade drywall lift features a new and improved advanced gear system, providing easier lifting, positioning and installation of drywall, sheetrock and wood panels on ceilings or walls, for stress-free and efficient work. Telescoping mast allows for quick and smooth sheetrock raising/lowering, accommodating panels up to 4' x 16' in size.

SUPERIOR REACH: Simply and easily hoists panels overhead, as lift features an 11' reach for flat ceilings. Large cradle extends to 7' in width, rotates 360 degrees and tilts 65 degrees forward for use on both flat and sloped ceilings.

STABLE & SECURE: Cradle features auto-locking outriggers and panel support tabs to hold panels in place and the entire unit is supported by a 4' wide tripod base with anti-slip locking casters for secure mounting.
HEAVY-DUTY CONSTRUCTION: Constructed with a superior, all-welded, heavyweight steel frame and enamel finish, this lift provides long-lasting durability and reliable performance.
EASY TOOL-FREE SETUP: Ideally suited for busy contractors and professionals, this lift features quick, tool-free setup and disassembly convenient portability and storage.
